page.title: 03SUPERNATURAL
page.content:
Near La Moye Point is a cave that was supposedly connected to St.Saviours church by a subterranean passage.This passage was supposed to contain a table and drinking vessels of stone and was one of the entrances to fairyland.Because of this,the cave was avoided at night,which made it an important hide-out for smugglers until the late nineteenth century.
Although the area was sparsley haunted and there are few reported ghosts,travellers were loathe to pass through the districts and a number of crosses were set up to comfort anyone who had to pass by.
